definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Or was it something in the expensive bottled water in Beverly Hills where Oscar organizers are based.
sentences.chinese: 也许是因为贝弗利山昂贵的瓶装水中有些莫名物质。

sentences.english: It is quite baffling why he should have made such remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他为什么讲这番话，真叫人莫名其妙。

sentences.english: At times, his conflicted impulses got the best of him.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，一股莫名的冲突占据了他的内心。

sentences.english: Rain symbolizes wisdom. If a man encounters unforeseen rain or water, it's symbol of wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 雨主智，如果一个人莫名的遇到雨和水都是智慧运。

sentences.english: European officials described the tactics as inexplicable.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲官员形容为莫名的战术。

sentences.english: I just get my parole, and do not want to be your scapegoat somehow.
sentences.chinese: 我才刚刚假释耶，不想莫名其妙的变成你的代罪羔羊。

sentences.english: The 750 million yuan deficit somehow got rounded up to 800 million yuan.
sentences.chinese: 七亿五千万的赤字莫名其妙地达到了八亿。

sentences.english: Missing is a power that can draws one's tears unintelligibly.
sentences.chinese: 思念就一种可以让人莫名其妙地掉下眼泪的力量。

sentences.english: Half the time I get an odd result.
sentences.chinese: 一半的时间，得到的结果都是莫名其妙。

sentences.english: Yours will be the ineffable joy of quaffing the cup of martyrdom for His sake.
sentences.chinese: 你得到的将是畅饮为祂殉道的莫名欢乐之杯。

sentences.english: Missing gnaws the pain to hold one kind inexplicably to pace back and forth innocently in my side.
sentences.chinese: 思念啃着痛含着一种莫名的无辜在我身边徘徊着。

sentences.english: I involuntarily love this kind of beauty, chilly and lonely.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢这种凄清的美，莫名所以地喜欢。

sentences.english: Idle thoughts floated through his mind.
sentences.chinese: 莫名其妙地想法浮现在他心头。

sentences.english: Theie reason for doing it is still a puzzle to me.
sentences.chinese: 他们为什么要做此事我仍莫名其妙。

sentences.english: Most of the left has followed this confusing usage.
sentences.chinese: 多数左派迄今都是沿用的这个莫名其妙的用法。

sentences.english: Consequently, you may experience fatigue or listlessness without realizing why.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你可能会莫名其妙地感到疲劳或无精打采。

definition: to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
